channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Louisiana officials continue search for last of three escaped inmates
item.description: Three men fled Opelousas jail after removing concrete blocks from wall in state’s second inmate escape of year Authorities on Sunday were hunting for ...

item.title: Senior DWP civil servant blames victims for carer’s allowance scandal
item.description: Neil Couling said failings by individual claimants ‘at the heart’ of crisis, despite a report finding DWP shortcomings ‘unacceptable’ One of the most ...

item.title: Three more Farage bloc MEPs alleged to have followed Russian asset’s script

item.title: First phase of Gaza ceasefire plan nearly complete, says Netanyahu

item.title: Active travel groups call for clear targets on walking and cycling in England
item.description: Exclusive: Groups including British Cycling call for active travel strategy to be put on equal footing with road and rail More than 50 groups connecte...

item.title: Backed by his family, propelled by his talent: the rise of Lando Norris
item.description: F1 world champion Lando Norris has long seemed destined for the top of his sport, as key figures who worked with him through the junior categories tel...

item.title: Nightclub fire in India's Goa kills 25 staff and tourists
item.description: Eyewitnesses described scenes of panic in one of Goa's bustling nightlife areas.

item.title: New US security strategy aligns with Russia's vision, Moscow says
item.description: The Kremlin welcomes the starkly worded document, which does not cast Russia as a threat to the US.

item.title: Martin Parr: Photographer whose colourful images captured British life dies aged 73
item.description: Parr rose to prominence in the mid 1980s, his colourful images capturing British life.

item.title: Benin coup attempt foiled by loyalist troops, interior minister says
item.description: A presidential adviser tells the BBC that President Patrice Talon is in a safe location.
